channel.title: Having some webclient problems should be easy fix
channel.description:
Here's what I'm working with:
Bluur client 317, Delta base.
I've followed Ric's webclient tutorial -[url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=336494.0]http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=336494.0[/url]- and I'm a little lost. Everything should be working. My cache is loading from the right place, no errors in my compiler, etc. My webpage even shows the zip file unpacking.
Looks like this: [code] 984 09-20-08 10:26 cache/PreloadingModels/20263.DAT 19629 11-08-09 03:17 cache/PreloadingModels/22790.dat 2340 10-13-09 22:28 cache/PreloadingModels/23152.dat 630 08-07-09 15:39 cache/PreloadingModels/2391.dat 220 10-28-09 14:12 cache/PreloadingModels/25000.dat 7548 10-25-09 22:47 cache/PreloadingModels/25671.dat 8074 10-25-09 22:47 cache/PreloadingModels/25672.dat 1388 10-26-09 14:36 cache/PreloadingModels/25684.dat 882 10-26-09 14:36 cache/PreloadingModels/25685.dat 1309 09-14-09 15:13 cache/PreloadingModels/26294.dat 295 06-15-09 12:44 cache/PreloadingModels/26306.dat 571 06-15-09 12:48 cache/PreloadingModels/26307.dat 853 06-15-09 12:44 cache/PreloadingModels/26308.dat 1138 06-15-09 12:45 cache/PreloadingModels/26309.dat 1408 06-15-09 12:45 cache/PreloadingModels/26310.dat 1760 09-14-09 15:13 cache/PreloadingModels/26377.dat [/code]
But when I go to the webclient page on my site, I get the red "!" in the corner and the error says
[code] Java Plug-in 1.6.0_24 Using JRE version 1.6.0_24-b07 Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM User home directory = C:\Documents and Settings\Peter ---------------------------------------------------- c: clear console window f: finalize objects on finalization queue g: garbage collect h: display this help message l: dump classloader list m: print memory usage o: trigger logging q: hide console r: reload policy configuration s: dump system and deployment properties t: dump thread list v: dump thread stack x: clear classloader cache 0-5: set trace level to <n> ----------------------------------------------------
load: class client.class not found. java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: client.class at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass0(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadCode(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager.createApplet(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager$AppletExecutionRunnable.run(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) Exception: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: client.class [/code]
Ric's advice was to delete the class files, but that didn't work. I'm trying nearly everything to get this up but I can't figure it out. Help please...

item.title: Having some webclient problems should be easy fix
item.dc:creator: @legit_99 legit 99
item.description:
@legit_99 wrote:

I’ve literally redone the tutorial 5-10 times. I’m 99% sure everything is set up correctly…

Does this help at all?
This is in my client.java explaining where the download link is and what the filename is called. everything is correct there… wtf is wrong…

{
							method13(15, (byte)4, "Downloading Cache");
downloadcache("http://dl.dropbox.com/u/2320554/xelphoriacache.zip", "xelphoriacache.zip", "", "cache");		      
}

Read full topic
item.source: Having some webclient problems should be easy fix

item.title: Having some webclient problems should be easy fix
item.dc:creator: @lostmyphat lostmyphat
item.description:
@lostmyphat wrote:

Re-doing the tutorial is your best bet. You probably messed up somewhere.

Read full topic
item.source: Having some webclient problems should be easy fix

item.title: Having some webclient problems should be easy fix
item.dc:creator: @legit_99 legit 99
item.description:
@legit_99 wrote:

Here’s what I’m working with:

Bluur client
317, Delta base.

I’ve followed Ric’s webclient tutorial -http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=336494.0- and I’m a little lost. Everything should be working. My cache is loading from the right place, no errors in my compiler, etc. My webpage even shows the zip file unpacking.

Looks like this:

      984  09-20-08 10:26   cache/PreloadingModels/20263.DAT
    19629  11-08-09 03:17   cache/PreloadingModels/22790.dat
     2340  10-13-09 22:28   cache/PreloadingModels/23152.dat
      630  08-07-09 15:39   cache/PreloadingModels/2391.dat
      220  10-28-09 14:12   cache/PreloadingModels/25000.dat
     7548  10-25-09 22:47   cache/PreloadingModels/25671.dat
     8074  10-25-09 22:47   cache/PreloadingModels/25672.dat
     1388  10-26-09 14:36   cache/PreloadingModels/25684.dat
      882  10-26-09 14:36   cache/PreloadingModels/25685.dat
     1309  09-14-09 15:13   cache/PreloadingModels/26294.dat
      295  06-15-09 12:44   cache/PreloadingModels/26306.dat
      571  06-15-09 12:48   cache/PreloadingModels/26307.dat
      853  06-15-09 12:44   cache/PreloadingModels/26308.dat
     1138  06-15-09 12:45   cache/PreloadingModels/26309.dat
     1408  06-15-09 12:45   cache/PreloadingModels/26310.dat
     1760  09-14-09 15:13   cache/PreloadingModels/26377.dat

But when I go to the webclient page on my site, I get the red “!” in the corner and the error says

Java Plug-in 1.6.0_24
Using JRE version 1.6.0_24-b07 Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM
User home directory = C:\Documents and Settings\Peter
----------------------------------------------------
c:   clear console window
f:   finalize objects on finalization queue
g:   garbage collect
h:   display this help message
l:   dump classloader list
m:   print memory usage
o:   trigger logging
q:   hide console
r:   reload policy configuration
s:   dump system and deployment properties
t:   dump thread list
v:   dump thread stack
x:   clear classloader cache
0-5: set trace level to <n>
----------------------------------------------------


load: class client.class not found.
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: client.class
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass0(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadCode(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager.createApplet(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager$AppletExecutionRunnable.run(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
Exception: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: client.class

Ric’s advice was to delete the class files, but that didn’t work. I’m trying nearly everything to get this up but I can’t figure it out. Help please…

Read full topic
